org.myrobotlab.framework
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  org.myrobotlab.framework.Service
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, ServiceInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
_TemplateService, ACEduinoMotorShield, AdafruitMotorShield, Android, Arduino, ArduinoBT, Arm, AudioCapture, AudioFile, Bumper, ChatBot, ChessGame, ChumbyBot, Clock, ColoredThingyFinder, ComediDriver, Cortex, Drupal, FaceTracking, FrogLeg, FSM, FSMTest, GeneticProgramming, GestureRecognition, GoogleSTT, Graphics, GUI, Houston, HTTPClient, InMoov, IPCamera, JFugue, Joystick, Keyboard, Log, MagaBot, Mail, Mapper, MoMo, Motor, OpenCV, ParallelPort, PICAXE, PID, Player, PlayerStage, PointCloud, Proxy, Python, RecorderPlayer, Red5, RemoteAdapter, RobotPlatform, Roomba, ROS, Rose, Runtime, Scheduler, SensorMonitor, Serializer, Servo, Skype, SLAM, SLAMBad, SoccerGame, SoccerGame, Speech, Sphinx, SteamPunkBeerBot, SteamPunkGame, Stepper, StepperMotor, TestCatcher, TestThrower, ThingSpeak, Tracking, TweedleBot, WebServer, Wii, WiiBot, WiiDAR
public abstract class Service
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable, ServiceInterface

Service is the base of the MyRobotLab Service Oriented Architecture. All meaningful Services derive from this class. There is a _TemplateService.java in the org.myrobotlab.service package. This can be used as a very fast template for creating new Services. Each Service begins with two threads One is for the "Outbox" this delivers messages out of the Service. The other is the "run" thread which processes all incoming messages.

Author:
GroG Dependencies: apache Log4J - logging simpleframework - basic configuration
See Also:
Serialized Form

          a default way to attach Services to other Services An example would be attaching a Motor to a MotorControl or a Speaking service (TTS) to a Listening service (STT) such that when the system is speaking it does not try to listen & act on its own speech (feedback loop) FIXME - the GUIService currently has attachGUI() and detachGUI() - these are to bind Services with their swing views/tab panels.

copyShallowFrom

registerServices

public void registerServices(java.lang.String hostAddress,
                             int port,
                             Message msg)
Inbound registerServices is the method initially called to contact a remote process. Often is will be a GUI sending this request over the wire to be received in another process by a RemoteAdapter. if the registration of foreign Services is successful, the request is echoed back to the sender, such that all Services ready for export are shared. it is also invoked by RemoteAdapters as they recieve the initial request the remote URI is filled in from the other end of the socket info Since the foreign Services do not necessarily know how they are identified the ServiceEnvironment & Service accessURL are filled in here

Parameters:
hostAddress -
port -
msg -

getServiceResourceFile

public java.lang.String getServiceResourceFile(java.lang.String subpath)
a default way to attach Services to other Services An example would be attaching a Motor to a MotorControl or a Speaking service (TTS) to a Listening service (STT) such that when the system is speaking it does not try to listen & act on its own speech (feedback loop) FIXME - the GUIService currently has attachGUI() and detachGUI() - these are to bind Services with their swing views/tab panels. It should be generalized to this attach method

Parameters:
serviceName -
Returns:
if successful

echoHeartbeat

public Heartbeat echoHeartbeat(Heartbeat pulse)
called typically from a remote system When 2 MRL instances are connected they contain serialized non running Service in a registry, which is maintained by the Runtime. The data can be stale. Messages are sometimes sent (often in the gui) which prompt the remote service to "broadcastState" a new serialized snapshot is broadcast to all subscribed methods, but there is no guarantee that the registry is updated This method will update the registry, additionally it will block until the refresh response comes back

Returns:

public void startHeartbeat()

public void stopHeartbeat()

attach

public boolean attach(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.Object... data)
This method is a rounting method used to attach service to other services - the implementation of this method depends on what needs to be done in order to attach one service to another
